title: Contemporary Form in Traditional Art: Figurative Evolution in Classical Javanese Wayang Kulit
Dancing Shadows, Epic Tales: Wayang Kulit of Indonesia
summary:
This online exhibition presents an introduction to the performance, stories, and characters of wayang kulit (Indonesian shadow puppets):
http://online.internationalfolkart.org/dancingshadows/exhibition.html

The physical exhibition (2009-2010, Museum of International Folk Art. Santa Fe, NM, US) won an award from the American Alliance of Museums for Overall Excellence in Museum Exhibitions, 2010.

title: DALANG WAYANG KULIT
summary: There are five puppeteers who still exist in Manca Negari Barat. Of these five puppeetteers, only Nyi Arum who is still popular up to her middle age. This fact eliminates a perception that women puppetters are only popular when still young and beautiful, and also because their beauty and power are not commonly owned by ordinary women. To stay existent, a good rapport with the community is needed. Nyi Arum's status as a civil servant helps her perform in ceremonial events. Her social connection also gave her an opportunity to perform out of Java, and she will be invited to Netherlands. Nyi Arum holds her pride for remaining existent in the world of puppetteering in spite of the low frequency of invitation to perform. Nyi Arum also displays a gender-responsive attitude, which is shown in her creating stories which place women as the leading roles. She also inserted critiques and suggestions that women be independent and have career into the intermezzo sections of the stories such as in Limbukkan scenes. Besides that, Nyi Arum also actively discusses women in formal situation. A. Pendahuluan Berbicara masalah wayang, tidak lepas dengan dalang. Seorang dalang wayang kulit, menurut Ras (1985:4), meskipun ia hanya orang desa yang tidak terpelajar, oleh para penontonnya dianggap ahli seni sastra. Dalam waktu semalam dan seorang diri ia menyajikan pergelaran drama. Di samping unsur cerita narasi, ia juga menggunakan puisi kuna atau suluk, tembang macapat, dan dialog-dialog yang bersifat stereotipe. Seni wayang kulit di Jawa memiliki beberapa versi atau gagrak. Menurut Nugroho ada versi Yogyakarta, Surakarta, Banyumasan, Jawa Timuran, Pesisiran, dan Cirebonan (2001:9). Sementara itu, di Jawa Timur tidak hanya memakai satu versi, Jawa Timuran, melainkan ada dua versi yaitu versi Jawa Tengah (Yogyakarta dan Surakarta) dan Jawa Timuran. Kedua versi di atas memiliki pemetakan daerah pemakaian yang jelas. Di daerah-daerah yang oleh Koentjaraningrat (1984:30) disebut "daerah mancanegari barat", yakni daerah-daerah Madiun, Ponorogo, Pacitan, Magetan, Trenggalek, Blitar, Tulungagung, dan Nganjuk, cenderung digunakan versi wayang kulit Jawa Tengah. Sedangkan daerah-daerah wetan, seperti Kertosono, Jombang, Mojokerto, Sidoarjo, Gresik, Malang, Jember, dan Surabaya cenderung menggunakan versi wayang kulit Jawa Timur atau wayang "Jawa Timuran". Dalang wayang kulit tidak hanya pria saja. Meskipun tidak banyak jumlahnya, ada pula dalang wayang kulit wanita. Antara dalang wayang kulit pria dan wanita masih dibedakan. Hal tersebut berkaitan erat dengan pandangan masyarakat Jawa terhadap wanita. Dalam masyarakat Jawa kedudukan wanita dapat dilihat dari ungkapan-ungkapan: wong wadon iku swarga nunut neraka katut, wong wadon iku panggonane ing buri, kanca wingking (nasib wanita selalu bergantung kepada nasib suami, baik ataupun jelek, demikian pula nasib wanita di akherat, wanita selalu berada di belakang laki-laki). Wanita juga diibaratkan sebagai salah satu barang yang menjadi lambang keperkasaan laki-laki, yaitu wisma, curiga, turangga, wanita (rumah, pusaka, kuda, dan wanita) (Herri, 1981:23). Ungkapan-ungkapan tersebut mencerminkan bahwa wanita berada pada kedudukan yang lebih rendah dari pada laki-laki. Pandangan seperti itu dapat mempengaruhi dalang wayang kulit wanita dalam pola pertunjukan, cerita yang dapat 1 Disarikan dari Penelitian Berjudul: Dalang Wayang Kulit Perempuan Jawa Timur. Dibiayai oleh SKW

title: Tall Tree, Nest of the Wind: The Javanese Shadow-play Dewa Ruci Performed by Ki Anom Soeroto. A Study in Performance Philology (2016): contents, preface, first pp of edition
summary:
BLURB: Javanese shadow puppetry is a sophisticated dramatic form, often felt to be at the heart of Javanese culture, drawing on classic texts but with important contemporary resonance in fields like religion and politics. How to make sense of the shadow-play as a form of world-making? In Tall Tree, Nest of the Wind, Bernard Arps explores this question by considering an all-night performance of Dewa Ruci, a key play in the repertoire. Thrilling and profound, Dewa Ruci describes the mighty Bratasena’s quest for the ultimate mystical insight.
     The book presents  Dewa Ruci as rendered by the distinguished master puppeteer Ki Anom Soeroto in Amsterdam in 1987. The book’s unusual design presents the performance texts together with descriptions of the sounds and images that would remain obscure in conventional formats of presentation. Copious annotations probe beneath the surface and provide an understanding of the performance's cultural complexity. These annotations explain the meanings of puppet action, music, and shifts in language; how the puppeteer wove together into the drama the circumstances of the performance in Amsterdam, Islamic and other religious ideas, and references to contemporary Indonesian political ideology. Also revealed is the performance’s historical multilayering and the picture it paints of the Javanese past.
     Tall Tree, Nest of the Wind not only presents an unrivalled insight into the artistic depth of wayang kulit, it exemplifies a new field of study, the philology of performance.

research_interests.name: History of Folklore Theory and Method

title: PENCAHAYAAN DALAM REKABENTUK PEMENTASAN WAYANG KULIT MELAYU KELANTAN
summary: Abstrak Wayang kulit adalah satu persembahan tradisional masyarakat Melayu Kelantan. Persembahan wayang kulit Melayu Kelantan merupakan medium hiburan utama masyarakat Melayu tradisional hingga mencapai kemuncak penerimaannya pada awal tahun 60-an. Hal ini menjadikan persembahan wayang kulit Melayu Kelantan mempunyai interpretasi kepercayaan dan nilai budaya masyarakat dalam setiap aspek persembahannya. Aspek rekabentuk sesebuah pementasan wayang kulit Melayu Kelantan ini terdiri daripada panggung dan peralatannya merangkumi cahaya, kelir, patung, dalang dan muzik. Asas utama persembahan wayang kulit adalah cahaya, kerana persembahan ini merupakan aksi dan gerakan patung oleh dalang di kelir hasil bayang daripada lampu. Oleh itu, boleh dikatakan bahawa pengcahayaan merupakan aspek penting yang mendasari rekabentuk pementasan persembahan wayang kulit Melayu Kelantan.Namun, seiring dengan perubahan zaman, wayang kulit Melayu Kelantan semakin terpinggir dengan kemunculan medium hiburan moden yang lebih menarik perhatian generasi muda. Para pengamal persembahan terpaksa bersaing dengan tuntutan zaman dalam memastikan persembahan ini terus hidup di kalangan masyarakat. Hal ini melibatkan tolak ansur dan pengolahan aspek pementasan persembahan untuk memenuhi selera masyarakat. Proses ini dikatakan menghilangkan simbol dan nilai asal kepercayaan masyarakat tradisional dalam aspek persembahan wayang kulit Kelantan. Kertas penyelidikan ini bertujuan untuk menganalisis aspek pengcahayaan dalam rekabentuk pementasan wayang kulit Kelantan semasa yang berlangsung di Gelanggang Seni Kota Bharu, Kelantan selama 12 minggu (Mac – Jun 2015). Penyelidikan ini melibatkan pendekatan kualitatif melalui pemerhatian, wawancara, dokumentasi foto dan video. Hal ini bagi mengenalpasti kewujudan simbol dan nilai kepercayaan masyarakat tempatan melalui penggunaan jenis lampu dan peralatan serta fungsinya. Melalui penyelidikan ini, dapat dipastikan sejauh mana aspek pengcahayaan pementasan persembahan wayang kulit Melayu Kelantan masih mempunyai simbol dan nilai tradisional.

title: Kisah Kelahiran Togog, Semar dan Bathara Guru
summary: Tulisan ini membahas tentang kisa mengenai kelahiran tokoh pewayangan Togog, Semar dan Bathara Guru. Tujuan penulis, menulis tulisan ini tidak lain untuk membagi pengetahuan tentang tentang salah satu produk budaya Indonesia. Pewayangan sejatinya berasal dari India, tapi akulturasi pewayangan yang tampak dari pemunculan tokoh punakawan (Semar dan Togog) membuktikan wujud kreativitas para budayawan negara kita. Semoga dengan tulisan saya yang teramat singkat ini,bisa turut menumbuhkan kembali hasrat ketertarikan terhadap wayang di tengah arus modernitas.

title: WAYANG KULIT: FILEM ANIMASI PERTAMA DI DUNIA
Wayang Jawa Timuran Cengkok Trowulan: Asal-usual dan Penyebarannya
summary: Abstrak: Secara umum penelitian ini bertujuan untuk menggali identitas wayang kulit Jawa Timuran yang memiliki beraneka ragam cengkok atau gaya. Secara khusus ada tiga tujuan yang akan diwujudkan dalam penelitian ini, yaitu (1) mendeskripsikan karakteristik pertunjukkan seni wayang kulit Jawa Timuran cengkok Trowulan. Untuk mencapai tujuan pertama ini dituntut penggalian yang mendalam ke bentuk pementasan cengkok wayang kulit Jawa Timuran; (2) menemukan sebab musabab terjadinya aneka cengkok dalam pementasan wayang kulit Jawa Timuran cengkok Trowulan; (3) menemukan peta penyebaran cengkok wayang kulit Jawa Timuran cengkok Trowulan. Penelitian ini merupakan penelitian kualitatif. Sumber data penelitian adalah para dalang senior yang masih aktif mendalang di Mojokerto, khususnya cengkok Trowulan, yakni Ki Pitoyo. Di samping dalang, sumber data juga diambil dari tokoh masyarakat yang memiliki pengetahuan dan wawasan tentang wayang Jawa Timuran cengkok Trowulan. Data penelitian berupa bentuk pementasan, bentuk wayang, cerita, keterangan dalang dan tokoh masyarakat berkaitan dengan pertunjukan wayang Jawa Timuran, perkembangan, dan peta cengkok wayang Jawa Timuran, khususnya cengkok Trowulan. Lokasi penelitian ini adalah Mojokerto, khususnya Trowulan. Teknik pengumpulan data menggunakan teknik observasi dan wawancara. Teknik analisis data menggunakan teknik deskriptif. Hasil penelitian menunjukkan bahwa wayang Jawa Timuran cengkok Trowulan memiliki asal-usul yang berkaitan dengan wayang Jawa Timuran secara keseluruhan. Empu atau cikal bakal cengkok Trowulan, yakni Ki Pit Asmoro merupakan murid dari Ki Gunarso yang menjadi empu dalang wayang Jawa Timuran. Wayang Jawa Timuran cengkok Trowulan mendominasi wilayah Mojokerto dan berkembang ke luar Mojokerto yakni ke Jombang. Salah satu dalang senior yang masih eksis sampai sekarang adalah Ki Pitoyo. Pementasan Ki Pitoyo memiliki kekhasan, yakni menggabungkan seni campursari dengan kesenian wayang. Penggabungan tersebut memiliki tujuan agar wayang bisa diterima oleh generasi muda dan tua.

title: Indonesian performing arts in the Netherlands, 1913-1944
summary:
This essay surveys the Indonesian performing arts ‘scene’ created by Indonesians and Eurasians living in the Netherlands during the late colonial period through the end of World War Two, looking particularly at Javanese dance and music associations, Indische toneel (Indies drama), kroncong clubs, touring professional artists and pan-Indonesian student groups. The performing arts from Indonesia were initially inward looking. The first gamelan concert by Javanese students was organised to illustrate a lecture on music. Indies dramas fastidiously avoided issues of Otherness in order to affirm the Dutchness of the Dutch Indies. However, with the first Indische Kunstavond (Indies Art Evening) in 1916, the performing arts were used by Indonesian students studying in Holland to make a political point to the Dutch general public. Refined arts were a justification for a model of colonial relations in which indigenous and Dutch cultures were associated, rather than unified or assimilated. The integrity of Javanese culture was to be esteemed for the sake of inter-racial tolerance and respect. Political advancement was conditioned upon cultural exchange on even terms. 
With the exceptions perhaps of composer FH Belloni and playwright Jan Fabricius, artists did not come from colonial Indonesia to the Netherlands anticipating making a living from art. Yet Europe allowed new possibilities for some Indonesian dancers and other artists, starting with business-student-turned-professional-performer Raden Mas Jodjana. Jodjana identified himself as a modern Javanese artist, resulting in a polemic with conservative Dutch gatekeepers on hybridity, and whether it was possible to be both ‘Javanese’ and ‘modern.’
Increasingly, cultural organisations were interested in demonstrating pan-Indonesian unity through performance. One can see them as workshops for the formulation of Indonesian national culture, enshrined in the constitutional mandate (attributed to Hajar Dewantara) for the government to promote ‘the peaks of culture’ of the nation’s constitutive ethnic groups. These Indonesian associations were not exclusive, however; they incorporated Dutch as well as Eurasian members. 
Indonesian performance activity continued in the Netherlands under Nazi occupation. The Colonial Institute was a hive of activity, with an adult gamelan group made up mostly of sailors from east Java and a youth gamelan group. There were dramatic productions as well, including a spectacular production in August 1943 under the direction of ethnomusicologist Jaap Kunst and his associates at the Colonial Institute. New performers came into prominence during the occupation, including the Banyumas-born dancer, actor and storyteller Indra Kamadjojo, the stage name for Jan Leonard Broekveldt. Nostalgic performances concerning ‘our Indies’ displayed few signs of recognition that Indonesia was under Japanese occupation, and would not return willingly to Holland’s colonial embrace after Japan’s defeat.

title: Drona's betrayal and Bima's brutality: Javanaiserie in Malay culture [2018]
summary: The presence of elements explicitly identified as "Javanese" or "from Java" in traditional Malay literature and performance — settings, characters, objects, idioms, stories, texts, even entire genres like the renditions of Mahabharata story-matter — has mostly been ascribed to the putative prestige of the historical civilization of Java. Here I explore another point of view. Focusing on religiosity and ethics in a hikayat with Mahabharata stories, I propose the notion of javanaiserie, the creation of texts, performances, and other cultural artefacts designed to be considered Javanese. Javanaiserie has proven alluring in Malay contexts. Rather than as a matter of influence I suggest regarding javanaiserie as an active process of worldmaking, the creation of a reality that is culturally at once close to and distinct from an audience's everyday lifeworld, a reality that can be both elegant and evil, appealing as well as appalling.

research_interests.name: Ethnicity In Malaysia and Southeast Asia

title: PEMBUATAN ANCUR LEM IKAN
summary: Lem yiyit ikan dibuat dari jerohan dan bagian ikan yang terbuang lainnya termasuk tulang, tetapi terutama struktur bertulang dan kepala ikan. Selama pengolahan, lem yang terkandung didalam bahan yiyit ikan terutaman didalam tulang dan kepala ikan, dilarutkan dan menghasilkan larutan berwarna bening atau buram. Biasanya bahan yang dipakai menggunakan bahan baku baik segar maupun berupa ikan asin. Bahan segar dicuci dahulu, sedang bahan ikan asin dicuci berulang-ulang sehingga air cucian tidak mengandung garam lagi. Setelah dicuci, bahan ditempatkan di tangki bertekanan dan dimasak. Sejumlah kecil asam kadang-kadang ditambahkan, pada prakteknya biasa digunakan dua galon asam asetat untuk setiap empat ton bahan. Bahan dimasak pada tekanan 12-15 pon selama sekitar dua setengah jam dan cairan lem encer kemudian dikeluarkan dan kemudian dikentalkan di alat penguap untuk memperoleh kekentalan yang diinginkan. Produk yang dihasilkan sudah berguna dalam banyak kegunaan, namun dalam hal ini diinginkan untuk mendapatkan lem yang lebih bening. It has been discovered that the opaque or opalescent appearance of the glue solution is due to the presence of certain non-adhesive materials, the elimination of which not only improves the quality of the glue from the adhesive standpoint, but also renders it clear and transparent, which is important where a clear glue is required and as an enhancement of the marketability of the product. Sebelumnya sudah diketahui bahwa produk lem yang buram adalah karena adanya kandungan bahan bukan lem yang ikut terlarut, jika bahan tersebut dapat dihilangkan maka tidak hanya meningkatkan kualitas daya rekat lem, tetapi juga menjadikan produk menjadi bersih dan bening, yang sangat penting untuk keperluan lem bening dan sebagai peningkatan daya jual produk. Pada Patent No. 1,895,446 Amerika Serikat yang penulis juga sebagai rekan penemu, menjelaskan metode untuk membuat lem berbahan tulang. Telah diketahui bahwa metode yang dijelaskan dan diklaim dalam paten tersebut tidak dapat diberlakukan untuk pembuatan lem bahan kulit hewan ternak atau dari kulit ikan, misalnya, atau untuk lem kasein, tetapi bahwa lem dari jeroan ikan dapat dibuat dengan cara yang sama dengan yang diajarkan di paten untuk digunakan dengan lem tulang. Seperti yang dijelaskan dalam paten tersebut, bahwa pengolahan lanjutan cairan lem dengan asam seperti asam fosfat atau asam sulfat menyebabkan gumpalan alkali akan timbul dalam larutan dan akan mengendap pada pH 7,0 atau sekitar itu. Jika keasaman larutan disesuaikan menjadi pH 5.0 atau lebih rendah, garam-garam gumpalan alkali akan kembali melarut. Gumpalan Alkali memiliki efek membuat lem menjadi buram dan oleh karena itu, pada umumnya dalam pengolohan lem cair ditambahkan dengan asam fosfat atau asam sulfat untuk membuat keasaman lem cair menjadi pH 7,0 yang paling mudah dilakukan dalam praktek dengan memakai kertas lakmus sebagai indikator. Hal ini ada menunjukkan bahwa gumpalan alkali yang dapat dihilangkan sebagai endapan pada pH 7,0 memiliki efek yang cukup pada kebeningan lem cair yang merupakan produk dari penemuan itu, dan saya telah menemukan bahwa hal yang sama berlaku untuk lem yang merupakan produk dari penemuan berikut ini. Namun, ada yang terkandung dalam semua jenis lem cair , sedikit bahan organic tertentu, yang tampaknya tidak mempengaruhi kebeningan lem kering, dan karena itu, bukan

title: Dancing Shadows: Javanese Wayang Kulit
PERKEMBANGAN WAYANG ALTERNATIF di BAWAH HEGEMONI WAYANG KULIT PURWA
summary: Abstrak Wayang sebagai suatu produk kreatif sering ditafsirkan secara sempit hanya pada seni pertunjukan wayang Purwa yang dalam rentang evolusi berabad-abad paling menunjukkan kemampuan adaptif. Hegemoni seni pewayangan sebagai salah satu produk kreativitas budaya Jawa paling adiluhung, pada sisi lainnya berdampak negatif pada evolutif kebudayaan Jawa itu sendiri. Proses refinement wayang sebagai seni adiluhung klasik dalam kantung-kantung budaya ekslusif kraton dalam saat yang sama mendapatkan tantangan diluar yang membuat seni pewayangan menjadi produk budaya populer yang bersifat kitch yang dianggap hanya sekadar hiburan yang tidak bernilai. Kemunculan karya wayang kontemporer dari para seniman Indonesia menandakan adanya gerak perkembangan di dalam usaha menafsirkan, mengeksplorasi, dan mengembangkan seni pewayangan tradisional memasuki medan kesenian yang lebih luas sehingga seni pewayangan tidak menjadi seni yang beku. Abstract Puppet as a creative product has interpreted narrowly only on the art of Purwa puppet show that in the span of centuries of evolution most show adaptive capabilities. The hegemony of puppet art as one of the products most valuable Java cultural creativity, on the other side has a negative impact on the evolutionary Javanese culture itself. title: Wayang Hip Hop: Java’s Oldest Performance Tradition Meets Global Youth Culture
summary: Wayang Hip Hop is a group led by dalang Ki Catur “Benyek” Kuncoro that combines Javanese wayang kulit conventions and hip hop music. This article traces the history of the group in relation to key developments in wayang kontemporer, while exploring controversies in its reception. Wayang Hip Hop is analyzed as an important new version of wayang that has garnered substantial attention from young spectators. Five reasons for the appeal of the performance are identified: (1) its complex musical intersections, (2) the radical adaptation of classical wayang stories to address contemporary problems, (3) the extension of the conventions of the gara-gara comic interlude into a full performance, (4) the adaption of Javanese wisdom to new settings, and (5) the adaptability of the production, which can has been presented in very diverse contexts.

title: The Wayang Kulit Display at the Burke Museum in Seattle
Tasvirin Gölgesi - Karagöz ve Wayang Kulit
Waryo S.Sn - SEKILAS MENYINGKAP SEJARAH DAN KEUNIKAN WAYANG PURWA GAGRAK CIREBON
summary:
“Susuhunan ing Kalijaga anyiosaken kang ringgit, umatur Susuhunan Bonang, sumangga dinamel kalih rampug sakathahing Wali miwah gusti Sunan Ratu, Kajoran kinen damelaken nyithak dados kekalih ingkang kajiyad ing Pangeran Kajoran. Gelise ingkang carita, ringgit wus cinitak, kalih Kajoran wus winastanan, Pangrean Kalingireki wus katur ing para Wali, sampun dados sakati kang dinamela. Sawise nganggit gamelan, amangun keramat Wali, Pasarean ing Astana, dinamel kalaning wengi, anuju ing tahun Alip, ping sadasa riyayanya, terape ing ba’da Isa, anuju sampun radin, sigra bubar sakathahing Wali Sanga”( Babad Cirebon: Pupuh Sinom )
.
“Sunan Kalijaga berkenan menyerahkan wayang, Sunan Bonang meminta agar segera dibuatkan dan diperbanyak. Semua para Wali menerimanya dan setuju untuk dipergelarkan. Gusti Sunan Ratu yaitu Sunan Purba, segera memerintahkan Pangeran Kajoran melakukan pembuatanya. Pangeran Kajoran kemudian membuat wayang dan setelah selelsai segera pula diserahkannya, para Wali menerima semua wayang yng telah dibuat dan Pangeran Kajoran disebut dengan nama Pangeran Kalang. Selanjutnya para Wali membuat gamelan, sebagai pengiring pertunjukan. Pada tanggal 10 riyaya ( Raya Agung=Besar ) tahun Alip malam hari mulai ba’da isa diadakan “Pakeliran Wayang Kulit” di Gunung Sembun, pada malam itu para wali berkenan membangun keramat Wali sebuah tajug di Gunung Sembung semalam telah jadi. Waktu subuh semua telah selesai, para Wali kembali pulang ketempat masing-masing”( Babad Cirebon: Pupuh Sinom )

title: The benefits of purity in Amarta and Surakarta: the shadowplay of Bima Suci, 1817–1818
summary: This paper, part of a project on religious worldmaking at the court of Paku Buwana IV in Surakarta, focuses on a category of ideas about worldmaking that were ambient among the Javanese social elite. The quest, an agential, typically person-focused form of worldmaking, narrative in character, appears in variable figurations in many historical environments and different cultural domains across the globe. I describe how a literary rendition of the Javanese mythological narrative of quest known as "Bima Purified" (Bima Suci) was made into a shadowplay in 1817–1818 and how it resonated with ideas of Sufi questing in court circles.

title: Dewa Ruci door Ki Anom Suroto (Inleiding, deel v.d. tekst, vertaling) [1990] (See Arps 2016, Tall Tree, Nest of the Wind, for a full edition and translation of the same performance)
summary: For an English translation of the entire performance, see Arps, Tall Tree, Nest of the Wind (NUS Press, 2016).

title: TANDA & PETANDA DALAM FILEM 'WAYANG'
A Study of Visualization Elements of Shadow Play Technique Movement and Computer Graphic Imagery (CGI) in Wayang Kulit Kelantan
summary: In the attempt to preserve and safeguard the unique heritage of Wayang Kulit (Shadow Play),UNESCO has designated it as a Masterpiece of Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity on 7th November 2003. Wayang Kulit Kelantan in Malaysia is threatened with imminent extinction. This paper reviews the critical situation of Wayang Kulit Kelantan in Malaysia. The visualization and movement of Wayang Kulit Kelantan is described into four major aspect, which are the puppets, shadows, screen for shadow projection (Kelir) and its light source. It also reviews the comparison methods and techniques between Wayang Kulit Kelantan traditional shadow play and Computer Graphics Imagery (CGI) used as a prototype design in traditional Wayang Kulit Kelantan.

ordered_authors.display_name: International Journal of Computer Graphics & Animation (IJCGA)

title: Flat Puppets on an Empty Screen, Stories in the Round (2016)
summary: The puppets are flat, the screen against which they are placed and moved is white and devoid of scenery. In what kinds of space do the stories of the classical shadow-play of Java, Bali, Lombok, and the Malay world unfold despite this double flatness? How do performers use not only puppets and screen but also music and language to bring space into being? What must spectators know and do to make sense of these storytelling techniques? As a contribution to the narratological study of the multimodal making of storyworlds, I demonstrate that wayang kulit caters for different degrees of interpretive competence, which yield different understandings of the space that wayang portrays. An expert way of apprehending space requires seeing beyond the screen, puppets, and silhouettes, or even looking away from them. At the same time the peculiar ways of narrating space in wayang point to a deeply felt spatiality in real-life contexts as well.

title: The Essence of Wayang in Modern Indonesian Artworks: Examining the Works of Nasirun and Heri Dono-NC-ND) (https://creativecommons.org/ licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0
summary: In Indonesia, Java specifically, wayang holds a significant cultural role. More than a story-telling technique, wayang is embedded deeply in the magico-spiritual beliefs and mysticism of the Javanese sphere. During prehistoric times, wayang was used as a tool to narrate both the Ramayana and the Mahabharata epics in Indonesia as well as the Southeast Asian region. In its primary form, Wayang Kulit Purwa dates back to the 10 th century in the Southeast Asian region. Over the years, wayang transcended its primary form to transform into more creative and expressive forms such as oral literature, bas reliefs, dance dramas, stage performances, fine arts and visual paintings-as such the essence of wayang persists in other fields. Although over centuries, the technicality and performance of wayang kulit have evolved and transformed into a multitude of creative art forms, the essence of wayang has continued its presence in modern features and contemporary context based on the persistence of symbolism and its mysticism that could be traced and highlighted in these works. This article examines the works of modern Indonesian artists Nasirun and Heri Dono by discussing the essence of wayang, through its symbolism and mysticism in particular, as this paper will argue, present in their works.

research_interests.name: Art, Iconography and Religion (Hindu and Buddhist).

title: "Lysistrata" in Pakeliran: The " Javanisation " of A Greek Epic in The Wayang Play "Nirasmara"
summary: In Lysistrata, Aristophanes depicted his critique through the women's protest of the prolonged war between Athens and Sparta that had negative impacts on the people's livelihood. In Indonesia, Ki Jlitheng Suparman, through his Wayang Climen style, adapted the idea in Lysistrata and turned it into a traditional Javanese shadow puppet (wayang) play he titled Nirasmara. It converted various aspects of the Greek epic, such as the characters and story background, into the style of wayang. Lysistrata then, both conceptually and naratologically, went through " Javanisation ". This paper examines whether this transfer of the cultural codes and the performance art styles of Nirasmara affected essential storylines of Lysistrata.

title: Makna dan Filosofi Perangkat Pagelaran Wayang -Ki Ghaib Siswoyo
summary: Makna serta filosofi perangkat pagelaran wayang kulit / wayang purwo, makna kelir/layar, debog, lampu atau blencong, kotak wayang, gedok dan sebagainya.

research_interests.name: Aplikasi Pengenalan Karakter Tokoh Wayang Kulit

title: Exhibition Review by K. Foley: Dancing Shadows, Epic Tales
Kompleksitas Tokoh Pandita Drona dalam Artefak Wayang Kulit Cirebon
summary: Since early centuries of Christian calendar, the Indian epics Mahabharata and Ramayana have wide­ ly spread across the Nusantara Archipelago. By the time these epics arrived here, they were not presented in their genuine forms, but had been adopted and localized in order to approach the natives. The adaptation process included taking the shadow theatrical form, translating and interpretating the stories, and transforming character and visual descriptions which were manifested into puppet form. One of the character transformations which includes personality and visual descriptions was done to Priest Drona, the vital character roled as guru to both Pandawas and Kurawas, who was trapped inside the dilemma among his disciples. In Javanese version, Drona has been transformed into an ambiguous, mischievous, and slightly humorous character. In Cirebon version, Drona was depicted as an evil character who provoked the Battle of Bharata yuddha. Drona puppet himself has unique and specific visual attributes compared to other puppet main characters, and each form of puppet Drona possess a high simbolic meaning beneath them. The problem is how do the visual attributes of each puppet tell us about the character's complexity? This paper analyzes every visual variation of Drona leather puppet in Cirebon using the Art Crit­ icism methods and semiotics referring to general Javanese Shadow Puppetry performance. This analysis proves the complexity of the character based on the differences of cloth, accessories and other visual attributes from Cirebon perspective.

ordered_authors.display_name: Mohammad Isa P R A M A N A Koesoemadinata

title: The Asian Novels of C.J. Koch
Peran Sunan Kalijaga Terhadap Bentuk Wayang Kulit Jawa
summary: This article examines the story of wali sanga, or to be more precise the story which connects Sunan Kalijaga with the art of shadow puppetry in detail. The story about how and why did Sunan Kalijaga change the shape of wayang figures is well known by all Indonesians. This research will examine if according to Islamic law, was it really required to change the shape of wayang figures or not. We will also talk about the way of thinking about depicting important figures in other religions, such as in Hinduism and in Buddhism too. After we saw all the different points of view and rules about this in the different traditions, we will be able to draw a new conclusion about the story of Sunan Kalijaga. This article analyses different works on Islamic law (fiqh) and written sources from the Hindu tradition too. Photographic evidence about reliefs in candis and wayang puppets are used as well.

title: DI STAZIO G., De l'ombre à la lumière. Les théâtres balinais et javanais
summary:
La culture du théâtre en Indonésie est très riche ainsi que ses répertoires d'histoires et de légendes. Afin de les appréhender au mieux, la présente étude se limite aux îles de Java et de Bali. Il existe quatre traditions théâtrales principales en Indonésie que l'on peut résumer sous le vocable Wayang. 
Le Wayang Kulit est un théâtre d'ombres dont la particularité est de pouvoir être regardé des deux côtés de l'écran. Le Wayang Topeng à Java et la danse masquée avec un Topeng à Bali sont une forme de théâtre dansé. Le Wayang Klitik, aujourd'hui disparu, et le Wayang Golek sont typiques de Java. Le premier consiste en des marionnettes plates en bois alors que le second met en scène des marionnettes en ronde-bosse.

title: Transcending Boundaries: Wayang Kulit Without the Shadows, by  Sarah Weiss, in Bohlman and Engelhardt 2016.pdf
summary: This article explores the ways in which wayang kulit performances, both traditional and contemporary-interpretive, are negotiating the boundaries between serving as a religious ritual and serving as entertainment. It turns out that it is possible for one performance to do both. After demonstrating that no more than about 60% of the material in a wayang performance is predictable or fixed, I point out that it is precisely the tradition of improvisation and flexibility embedded in the genre that has made possible the persistence of large audiences and shifting meanings across centuries. While some traditional Javanese genres have been rendered vestigial, wayang is thriving, adapting itself, trying new things, dispensing with those novelties that become trite or unpopular, and persistently staying current and relevant over the course of the twentieth century, such that wayang’s ritual efficacy has been maintained.  This is the published version of the item listed as forthcoming: Transcending Boundaries: Javanese Wayang Kulit Without the Shadows.

title: "Krisna's Theatre" in Krisna Murti Mute Theatre Bentara Budaya
summary: Text written for Krishna Murti exhibition, Mute! Theatre, 2010, Bentara Budaya Jakarta

title: The Intermedial Interrogation of Memory
summary: Javanese Wayang Kulit shadow puppetry is one of Asia's oldest performance traditions. This article characterizes wayang as a memory theatre and pays particular attention to contemporary versions of this theatre form. New developments in wayang, carried out by artists such as Fauzan Zan, Tavip Lampung and Erandaru, integrate the usage of video cameras, infrared technologies and cinematic conventions. In order to analyze what the inclusion of these media and conventions means for Wayang as a memory theatre, these performances are analyzed from the point of view of intermediality. Two concepts are used in order to make sense of these performances in relation to tradition and memory: intermedial tradeoffs and lingering aesthetic mechanisms.

title: DIGITAL WAYANG KULIT MODEL FOR LEARNING MATHEMATICS
summary: We propose a model that illustrates how digital Wayang Kulit (DWK) helps students learn mathematics in primary school. Wayang Kulit (WK) is unlikely to last long due to lack of safeguarding. Hence, there is an urgent need to preserve this cultural heritage from extinction. Drawing from the facts that there is deficient in performance of primary school children in mathematics. Henceforward, we proposed a conceptual model that illustrates how digital WK helps students learn mathematics. We use the model to develop a DWK using RAD method. The DWK, given a persona name e-WayCool, demonstrates how WK can be transformed into mathematics' learning object. In order to support the engagement and entertainment in DWK, the needs for effective interaction design with three dimensions of Interaction Design (IxD) theory are added. The 15-questions USE was distributed to measure the performance of DWK. The students perceived e-WayCool as useful (79%) and satisfying (83.4%). The result showed that the students perceived high satisfaction towards the proposed digital WK. It indicates DWK is effective for mathematics learning at primary level, and as such, the model proposed can be generalised to a wider domain.

title: Wayang Kulit Pesisiran Laseman di Acara Slasa Legen Unnes
summary: Menggali wayang kulit pesisiran lasem yang sudah diambang kepunahan

title: The Paralipomena of "The Tragical History of Jackson Pollock, Abstract Expressionist"
summary: In 1999, I staged a performance of a strange cultural artifact: a feature length shadow-puppet play in a mixed tradition, part Greek karaghiozis, part Bunraku, part Wayang Kulit, part old American musical. Its subject made this mix much stranger: the life of painter Jackson Pollock. But it gets curiouser. The play was not supposed to be written by me, nor was I the director. It was purportedly the work of two fictional characters, Alfred Hoos and Yannis Philaretos, heroes of a novel-in-progress called The Republic. Ironies abound: the play that those two people were supposed to have written and directed in the novel--but hadn't really, this being a novel--was not supposed to exist. Yet it does, so much so that you can see it online https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BJMyQ4Bkiow The novel, on the contrary, was meant to exist. But it doesn't. Now, in "Paralipomena" I make available a large collection of material created by Hoos and Philaretos, as also by an un-named scholar studying their lives and work. Biographical stuff, chronologies, snippets of their works, interviews, poems, paintings, they are all there, giving a rationale of the creation of the "The Tragical History of Jackson Pollock, Abstract Expressionist."

title: Wayang kulit
The power of the heart that blazes in the world: an Islamic theory of religions in early modern Java [2019]
summary:
(Open access, see below.)
The prominence of Hindu-Buddhist mythology, imagery, and religiosity in Islamic Java has puzzled observers. The shadow play with its Mahābhārata- and Rāmāyaṇa-derived subject matter is a prime example. Another is the late 18th-century ‘renaissance’ of Old Javanese literature in the Islamic kingdom of Surakarta, which produced classics still celebrated today. Beyond a misguided assumption that the Javanese were so strongly disposed to syncretism that blatant doctrinal clashes did not bother their intellectuals, the factors that animated this enterprise remain obscure, despite its critical consequence for the development of Javanese religiosities. I scrutinize several unstudied manuscripts and piece together information from hitherto unconnected scholarship to try to understand these factors, with reference to pressing circumstances, living theories, as well as people who think, feel, and hope. First I examine Javanese theoretical ideas about the relationship between the Hindu-Buddhist and Islamic traditions and the connection between epic narratives and the present and future of Java. Against this background I consider the initiative, in 1778, to reinterpret the ancient epic heritage, beginning with the Arjunawiwāha (composed c. 1030). Focal points of interest in the Islamic hermeneutics of this poem were a quest for inner potency and the resulting external power of violence, knowledge and revelation, and future kingship.

title: Thesis Abstract Rachel Hand
summary: My thesis examines knowledge transmission of Javanese gamelan music, wayang puppetry and traditional dance in Central Java from the 1920s to the 2010s. Tracing the history of a large performing artist family during this period, I describe the establishment of formal arts education, changes in family lifestyle and technological developments, as well as political events that had an impact on performing arts teaching and learning. By examining arts knowledge transmission during this period, my thesis shows that Javanese performing arts have been sustainable through the ability of artists to adapt their learning to new situations.

title: Thomas Moog (2013): Java – Wayang Kulit, Göttliche Schatten
Wayang dalam Persinggungannya dengan Nilai Modern
summary: wayang sebagai artefak budaya bangsa pada saat ini dihadapkan pada berbagai permasalahan. salah satunya adalah kegagalan melihat wayang secara utuh, sehingga menyebabkan kedangkalan pemahaman.

title: Rola wayangu w dekolonizacji Indonezji, [w:] Azja i Afryka: inność – odmienność – różnorodność, red. Piotr Bachtin, Maciej Klimiuk, Warszawa 2014, s. 197-208
Współczesny wayang, [w:] Odcienie Indonezji, red. Renata Lesner-Szwarc, Toruń 2014, s. 133-148.
summary:
Artykuł w sposób syntetyczny przedstawia rozwój wayang kulit w ujęciu historycznym. Skupia sie na przedstawieniu twórczości dwóch dalangów ukazując tym samym jakie funkcje społeczne spełnia wayang w dzisiejszym społeczeństwie Jawy. Jednocześnie za pomocą opisu pracy tych dwóch artystów wskazane zostały drogi rozwoju współczesnego wayangu, od lat dziewięćdziesiątych XX wieku po rok 2013. 

The article in a synthetic way introduces the evolution of wayang kulit in the historical perspective. It focuses on presentation of the works of two dalangs showing the social functions contemporary wayang fulfills in today’s Java society. At the same time the description of the work of these two artists  indicate the paths of development of contemporary wayang since the nineties of the twentieth century to the year 2013.

title: Kompleksitas Tokoh Pandita Drona dalam Artefak Wayang Kulit Cirebon

ordered_authors.display_name: Mohammad Isa P R A M A N A Koesoemadinata

title: The Art of Wayang
Shamanic-Mystic-Syncretic Islam and Shadow Puppet Shamans in Javanese Traditions and Beliefs
summary:
Islam was remodelled by regional traditions to comply with its religious-philosophical ideas since the advent to Java (15C). The patterns of the ancestral, shamanic, mythical belief and Hindu-Buddhism were integrated within Sufi Islam, and Sufi principle of ‘universal toleration’ negotiated with pre-Islamic culture to affirm the “oneness of God”, transforming it in accordance with Islam. 
	According to Javanese Muslims, multi-tiered roof symbolises a mythical path to God, based on Sufis’ view; the four columns (soko guru) signify the spiritual context of the vertical unity between God and them, continued from the Hindu belief in the identity of self and the universal soul. In spiritual rituals, the water channel represents new creatures that will fill the void of the universe with life. 
A characteristic of Javanese mosques it is a serambi (veranda) where the shadow puppet (wayang) theatre was performed. In the beginning of Islamisation, mystic Sufis modified Hindu epics for converting pagans, played by wayang at the serambi. Javanese believe that the soul of ancestors was disguised as shadows to solve their problems in life. Consequently, the shadow puppet was a propagator for non-Muslims; a mediator to invoke ancestors by sacred rituals. Physically, in Sufi’s mysticism, a serambi is a limit between the sacred and secular world, and its location around water implies Muslims’ purification before entering the sacred mosque. This notion was derived from the Cosmos Mountain, Meru where Hindu gods were surrounded by oceans. 
My paper discusses shamanic-mystic-syncretic Islam and shadow puppeteers through tangible-intangible ideas and forms in different beliefs and traditions in Java.

title: PERKEMBANGAN DAN PERANAN WAYANG DI MASYARAKAT
summary: Bukan hanya di Jawa Tengah dan Jawa Timur saja perkembangan seni pedalangan/pewayangan berlangsung, tetapi disetiap daerah yang dahulu pernah dipengaruhi kebudayaan Hindu pasti ada perkembangan seni pewayangan dan seni pedalangan. Jawa Timur merupakan pusat perkembangan seni pewayangan yang pertama dan Jawa Tengah yang merupakan pusat perkembangan seni pewayangan sehajk penyebaran ajaran Islam yang pertama. Sudah dapat dipastikan bahwa penyebaran itu akan sampai pula ke daerah-daerah lainnya seperti daerah Jawa Barat.

ordered_authors.display_name: Irfan A B A H Buhun

title: Travel and Tourism Potential in Solo City, Indonesia
summary:
The present paper was written as a conclusion of a six-month research project in the field of travel and tourism, developed in Surakarta City known as Solo City, Indonesia.

The first part of the paper is a journey in the history of human travel that later turned into tourism and finally became the Travel and Tourism Industry. The data presented here relies on information available at the time of writing (2014).

The second part is dedicated to travel and tourism potential of Solo City based on the research conducted in the city area.

My hope is that the information presented here will be helpful for any individual or organization that has interest regarding the subject and it can be used in the future work  for the development of the local travel and tourism potential of Solo City towards a world class, sustainable and social-aware local Travel and Tourism Industry.

Terima kasih.

title: Wayang
Approaches to Learning Traditional Performing Arts in Central Java through a Direct Encounter
summary: This paper examines learning approaches that are used by Javanese practitioners of traditional performing arts, including gamelan musicians, dhalang (puppet masters of wayang) and dancers. Based on fieldwork interviews and participant observation in and around Surakarta (Solo), Central Java, I describe five learning approaches that have in common a direct encounter with live performing arts, which triggers an immediate learning process. These are learning by ear, simultaneous imitation, rehearsing and performing, exposure and absorption, and learning by association. Each learning approach is described based on the artists’ own accounts of teaching and learning, and supported by pre-existing literature in cognition studies and ethnomusicology. I show that most practitioners have engaged in multiple learning approaches, and also that knowledge of one art form often enables or aids learning in other art forms. Javanese performing arts continue to be popular and sustainable. The learnin...

title: A wayang mozgatója

title: Mysticism and Knowledge Transmission in Javanese Performing Arts (Paper presented at the 4th Symposium of the ICTM Study Group on Performing Arts of Southeast Asia, August 2016)
summary:
Mysticism has a rich history in Java and spiritual practices continue to be an important part of modern Javanese culture. Many Javanese practise forms of mysticism, part of a belief system called kejawèn (sometimes translated as Javanism) or kebatinan. This is syncretic, combining elements of animism, Hinduism, Buddhism and Islam. The links between kejawèn and traditional performing arts run deep and have been investigated elsewhere. 
	However, relatively little has been said about the role of mysticism in knowledge acquisition whereby spiritual processes are used to gain knowledge which is then put into use in daily life. Many Javanese performing artists practise mysticism as a way to acquire knowledge or skill. Indeed, some attribute their artistic success to such spiritual endeavours. Mysticism coexists with school-based learning, mass media and the internet, as ways in which performing arts knowledge is transmitted and acquired. Similarly, the same practitioners who engage in mysticism are also active in more modern educational systems. Based on original fieldwork, this paper will look at contemporary examples provided by performing artists of how they have used mysticism as part of their own processes of knowledge acquisition. 
Examining the use of such spiritual practices by performing artists shows that, in considering knowledge transmission in performing arts, it is important to consider processes that may fall outside the realm of typical learning. Practitioners believe they acquire knowledge or skill through such mystical means, and therefore this paper will demonstrate the value in examining such processes of knowledge transmission. Whether or not one believes that knowledge can be attained in such mysterious ways, these activities surely have some effect on their practitioners as people and therefore as performing artists.

title: Wayang Bocor, „Puppetry International” 38, 2015, s. 20-22.
Pengaruh Budaya Asing Dalam Jagad Pakeliran Purwa
Wayang Kulit Student Presentation
Blog Wayang dan Generasi Zaman Sekarang
summary: Wayang dan Generasi Zaman Sekarang Adalah wajar apabila timbul sementara keresahan terhadap kemungkinan lenyapnya nilai-nilai budaya tradisional karena tergeser nilai-nilai baru yang menyusup bersama berkembangnya teknologi modern. Nilai-nilai baru yang menciptakan sustem, dan kemudian membentuk pola pikir, yang selanjutnya akan mempengaruhi sikap. Adalah wajar pula apabila generasi sekarang kemungkinan daya tanggap dan apresiasi seninya kian menipis, sebab apa yang disajikan tidak sesuai lagi dengan pola pikir mereka. Maka tidaklah aneh jika anak-anak muda sekarang kurang minat terhadap pedalangan/pewayangan.

ordered_authors.display_name: Irfan A B A H Buhun

title: KONSEP ARTISTIK KARNO TANDING
summary: Artistic concept for wayang orang performance "Karno Tanding", directed by Drs. Sukisno, M.Sn. for Jalin #20 of Teater Lilin UKM, Universitas Atma Jaya Yogyakarta, 2019

title: Approaches to Learning Traditional Performing Arts in Central Java through a Direct Encounter
summary: This paper examines learning approaches that are used by Javanese practitioners of traditional performing arts, including gamelan musicians, dhalang (puppet masters of wayang) and dancers. Based on fieldwork interviews and participant observation in and around Surakarta (Solo), Central Java, I describe five learning approaches that have in common a direct encounter with live performing arts, which triggers an immediate learning process. These are learning by ear, simultaneous imitation, rehearsing and performing, exposure and absorption, and learning by association. Each learning approach is described based on the artists’ own accounts of teaching and learning, and supported by pre-existing literature in cognition studies and ethnomusicology. I show that most practitioners have engaged in multiple learning approaches, and also that knowledge of one art form often enables or aids learning in other art forms. Javanese performing arts continue to be popular and sustainable. The learning approaches examined in this paper contribute to such success because they support sites for knowledge transmission through direct encounters with arts as they are performed.

title: Indonesian Contemporary Wayang – from Sand to Hip Hop, [w:] South-East Asia. Studies in Art, Cultural Heritage and Relations with Europe, red. Izabela Kopania, Warsaw-Toruń 2012, s. 287-293
summary: Wayang, present for over 1000 years, the key to understand Java and Javanese. Theatre, in which animist, Hindu and Islamic traditions coexist. In XXI century uses modern means of expression, new forms, new subjects. Traditional leather puppets are replaced with sand or projection, gamelan music mixes with hip-hop. Dalang (puppeteer) becomes superstar who wants to be famous and says so, but is not afraid to criticize the government and corrupt politicians . Adding new elements to the rich, long-lasting tradition or building new one.

title: The Art of Wayang
A formacao do dalang em Bali o marionetista no teatro de sombras wayang kulit
summary:
O wayang kulit, o teatro de sombras de Bali é uma forma espetacular herdeira da tradição indobudista vinda de Java, no século XV, e um dos responsáveis pela indianização de Bali, através da utilização dramatúrgica das epopeias indianas. O processo de formação do dalang, o marionetista, é complexo, abrangendo um extenso aprendizado literário, linguístico, ritualístico e vocal. O dalang deve articular os mitos ancestrais e a contemporaneidade, transmitindo ensinamentos filosóficos e religiosos, além de comen- tar aspectos da sociedade atual.


The wayang kulit, the shadow theater of Bali, belongs to the Indo-Buddhist tradition, that came from Java in the fifteenth-century, and is one of the responsible for the indianization of Bali, by the use of Indian epics. The formation process of the dalang, the puppeteer, is complex, encompassing an extensive literary, linguistic, ritualistic and vocal learning. The dalang must articulate the ancestral myths and the contemporaneity, dispensing philosophical and religious teachings and commenting aspects of the society as well.

title: The mover of wayang
summary: General description of the Javanese wayang.

title: “My Father didn’t Die; He was Killed”: The Effects of the 1965-66 Anti-Communist Mass Violence on a Central Javanese Performing Arts Community (Paper presented at The 11th Singapore Graduate Forum on Southeast Asian Studies, July 2016)
summary:
In 1965-66 many Javanese dhalang (wayang puppeteers) were prohibited from performing, imprisoned, tortured or even murdered. This was part of a wave of violence that spread across Java, eventually imprisoning or killing hundreds of thousands of Indonesians. Those targeted were ostensibly suspected of being communist sympathisers, members of the Indonesian Communist Party (PKI, Partai Komunis Indonesia). Their relatives, friends and colleagues in the performing arts community, including gamelan musicians, puppet makers and dancers, also felt the impact as it had a devastating effect on their work, and for their children, it affected their future education and career aspirations. The events of 1965-66, which led to the ousting of President Sukarno and the beginning of his successor Suharto’s long era, have been analysed by academics concerned with the politics and the underlying causes of the unrest (Cribb 1990, Kammen and Zakaria 2012, Kammen and McGregor (eds.) 2012). This paper will address the effects of what happened from the perspectives of the performing artists affected, whose families continue to feel the impact. 
	Wayang puppetry has often been linked to politics (Keeler 1987, Mrázek 2005). It is obvious how the role of the dhalang as a single performer without a script, with the freedom to speak his mind on stage to audiences of thousands, could be seen as threatening to the powers that be. During the early 1960s the PKI put on events which featured performing arts, thereby connecting the performing arts community, whether through the will of the artists or merely their financial need, to the party, and for some, sealing their fate. Using original fieldwork interviews supported by pre-existing sources to describe what happened to individual artists and then looking forward at the effects the violence has had on their families, this paper will show how such sudden political change has had a far-reaching impact on Javanese performing arts. 
	Following the brutal events of 1965-66, one might expect that Javanese performing artists would shy away from politics. However, this has not been the case. Political parties continue to sponsor lavish events where wayang is often the main attraction, and in one case a victim of 1965-66 has become one of the most outspoken political commentators in wayang today. This paper will therefore investigate some of the links between Javanese performing arts and the sudden political changes of the 1960s by taking a bottom-up approach, beginning from the arts practitioners affected.

title: Hofstra Symposium November 3, 2016- Traditions in Transition: Intangible Cultural Heritage in South and Southeast Asia
summary: Hofstra University will be presenting a symposium on November 3, 2016 that unites scholars from the disciplines of anthropology, ethnomusicology, folklore, theater and Asian studies to sacred traditions of South and Southeast Asia. Through the participation in workshops given by scholar-practitioners, performances of a central Javanese Gamelan orchestra, Sundanese rod puppetry theater, Sikh religious hymns, academic lectures, and a one-day installation of an exhibit of Malay puppets, costumes, instruments, and ethnographic photos of healing performances, participants in this symposium will gain insight into complex performance forms and explore the paradoxical issues currently facing the traditional arts and their definition as intangible cultural heritage in South and Southeast Asia.

title: 0812 180 3988, Obat Untuk Kesehatan Kulit, Obat Alami Untuk Kesehatan Kulit, Obat Herbal Untuk Kesehatan Kulit
summary:
obat untuk kesehatan kulit, obat alami untuk kesehatan kulit, obat herbal untuk kesehatan kulit, obat pemutih kulit, obat pemutih kulit wajah, vitamin untuk pemutih kulit, vitamin pemutih kulit, vitamin pemutih kulit wajah dan badan, vitamin buat pemutih kulit, vitamin pemutih kulit terbaik, obat suplemen kesehatan kulit, obat untuk menjaga kesehatan kulit, obat untuk kesehatan kulit wajah, obat mencerahkan kulit, obat alami melembutkan kulit wajah, obat alami melembutkan kulit, obat tradisional untuk melembutkan kilit wajah, obat alami untuk melembutkan kulit wajah, obat untuk melembutkan kulit, obat melembutkan kulit, obat kesehatan kulit

Kulit adalah bagian tubuh yang harus diperhatikan kesehatannya. Khususnya kaum perempuan yang memperhatikan penampilan. Kulit yang halus, sehat dan lembut merupakan idaman setiap wanita. Untuk merawat kulit bisa dilakukan dari cara yang mahal hingga yang murah. Salah satu metode perawatan kulit adalah dengan menggunakan lotion khusus kulit.

	Hand & Body Lotion dari Synergy merupakan lotion khusus perawatan kulit. Lotion ini melembabkan kulit juga memberi pasokan nutrisi penting bagi kulit. Lotion ini melembutkan dan melembabkan kulit tanpa meningggalkan minyak. Dengan teknologi Generasi III, berperan sebagai anti penuaan. Komposisi Generasi III ini, berperan dalam peningkatan pertumbuhan sel kulit, juga merangsang produksi kolagen untuk elastisitas. Teknologi Generasi IV memperbaiki pasokan bio pelindung yang membuat kulit tampak muda berseri. 

	Ekstrak acai dan vitamin baik sebagai antoksidan yang melindungi kulit dari kerusakan oksidasi. Barrier Repair Technology berperan dalam menjaga kulit sehat, menjaga kelembaban, dan mengeluarkan elemen-elemen yang berbahaya bagi kulit. Liquid Crystal Technology menyediakan sistem emulsi seimbang yang menjamin pengiriman bahan paling menguntungkan ke daerah kulit. Produk ini juga memiliki aroma alami dari minyak esensial yang menyegarkan. Selain itu, produk ini aman karena bebas dari bahan-bahan kimia.

	Hand & Body Lotion melembabkan dan menghidrasi pasokan nutrisi penting yang langsung menyerap kulit. Lotion mewah ini penting untuk melembabkan dan melembutkan kulit tanpa meninggalkan minyak.

	Tekstur liposomnya yang unik memberikan bahan-bahan aktif untuk melawan penuaan kulit dan mendukung proses yang berhubungan dengan sel. Komposisi kompleks Generasi III meningkatkan pertumbuhan sel dan merangsang produksi kolagen. Sedangkan teknologi Generasi IV bersifat memperbaiki pasokan bio pelindung yang mengembalikan penampilan kulit menjadi muda.

	Ekstrak acai dan vitamin menguntungkan kulit karena menyediakan antioksidan untuk memerangi radikal bebas. Sedangkan ekstrak alami herbal membantu menormalkan fungsi kulit. Hand & Body Lotion membuat kulit halus, lembut dan benar-benar lembab.  Itulah sebagian informasi tentang Hand & Body Lotion

Keuntungan Menggunakan Hand & Body Lotion

Memberikan kelembaban esensial pada kulit tanpa meninggalkan asam lemak alami.
Kandungan bioteknologi Generasi IV melindungi kulit dan membantu memperbaiki kerusakan yang disebabkan oleh UV dan paparan lingkungan.
Teknologi Liposom Generasi III bertindak cepat sebagai anti-penuaan dengan membantu meningkatkan pembaharuan sel kulit dan meningkatkan produksi kolagen.

Barrier Repair Technology berfungsi membantu menjaga kulit dalam keadaan optimal, menjaga kelembaban, dan mengeluarkan elemen-elemen penting yang berbahaya.

Liquid Crystal Technology menyediakan sistem emulsi seimbang yang menjamin pengiriman bahan paling menguntungkan ke daerah kulit.

Kombinasi khusus dari herbal adaptogenic membuat normal fungsi kulit dan memberikan anti-penuaan yang kuat dan sifat anti-stres untuk membantu kulit mengatasi faktor stres internal dan eksternal.

Buah acai (euterpe oleracea) yang kaya dengan antioksidan kuat, pitosterol dan anthocyanin, membantu memerangi penuaan dini kulit.

Vitamin A, B, C dan E memelihara kondisi kulit, dengan memberikan antioksidan sebagai pelindung dan pendukung kesehatan kulit.

Segar dengan aroma alami dari minyak esensial.

Bebas bahan-bahan kimia.

Kandungan Hand & Body Lotion

	Air, stearate gliseril, alkohol cetearyl, sodium lactylate stearoyl, gliserin, minyak benih tinctorius carthamus (safflower) , ester setil, ekstrak arabidopsis thaliana, lisis micrococcus, ekstrak umbilicalis porphyra, ekstrak pelvetia canaliculata, ekstrak pinnatifida undaria, lecithin, hydroxyproline dipalmitoyl, tall oil sterol, asam linoleic, tokoferol, sodium askorbat, manitol, ekstrak daun aloe barbandis, vitis vinifera Ekstrak anggur, ekstrak buah euterpe oleracea, ekstrak akar acanthopanax senticosus (eleuthero) , sari buah schizandra chinensis, ekstrak jamur ganoderma lucidum, ekstrak centella asiatica, ekstrak akar rhodiola rosea, buah zaitun, kaprilat trigliserida/kaprat, kedelai , minyak kedelai, allantoin, squalane, asam hyaluronic, biosaccharide gum-1, ergothioneine, retinyl palmitat, triasetat panthenyl, askorbat tetrahexyldecyl, asetat tokoferil, glycyrrhizate dipotassium, dimethicone, carbomer, gum xanthan, dinatrium EDTA, minyak atsiri, phenoxyethanol, glikol caprylyl, ethylhexylglycerin, glikol hexylene.

title: 0812 180 3988, Obat Alami Melembutkan Kulit, Obat Alami Melembutkan Kulit Wajah, Obat Alami Untuk Melembutkan Kulit Wajah
summary:
obat alami melembutkan kulit, obat alami melembutkan kulit wajah, obat alami untuk melembutkan kulit wajah, obat tradisional untuk melembutkan kulit wajah, obat untuk melembutkan kulit, obat melembutkan kulit, obat kesehatan kulit, obat herbal untuk kesehatan kulit, obat untuk kesehatan kulit, obat suplemen kesehatan kulit, obat alami untuk kesehatan kulit, obat untuk menjaga kesehatan kulit, obat untuk kesehatan kulit wajah, obat mencerahkan kulit, obat pemutih kulit, obat pemutih kulit wajah, vitamin untuk pemutih kulit, vitamin pemutih kulit, vitamin pemutih kulit wajah dan badan, vitamin buat pemutih kulit, vitamin pemutih kulit terbaik

Vera Gel

Elemence Vera Gel merupakan gel kulit multiguna dengan bahan utama Aloe Vera (lidah buaya) yang menyejukkan, tumbuh-tumbuhan yang bersifat menenangkan, dan enzim yang membantu memperbaiki kesehatan kulit. Aloe Vera telah dimanfaatkan selama ribuan tahun karena khasiatnya yang menyejukkan, dan konsentrat Aloe Vera tersebut menjadi bahan dasar produk berkualitas ini. 

Di samping Aloe murni, kombinasi enzim dengan ekstrak tumbuhan dan Algae membantu memelihara kesehatan DNA sel-sel kulit, meningkatkan respon alami pemulihan kesehatan kulit, dan membantu melindungi kulit dari pengaruh eksternal yang bersifat toksik dan stres internal jaringan kulit. Perpaduan bahan kandungan kompleks yang menerapkan TEKNOLOGI GEN IV ini merepresentasikan masa depan ilmu perawatan kulit dan menghadirkan perlindungan biologis dan proses perbaikan kulit berteknologi tinggi yang menghasilkan pemulihan proses peremajaan kulit. Vera Gel membuat kulit terasa segar dan tampak sehat.

Anjuran Penggunaan

Gunakan pada seluruh permukaan tubuh atau pada bagian kulit yang bermasalah sesering dengan yang Anda inginkan. Untuk hasil terbaik, gunakan sehabis mandi agar kelembaban kulit terjaga.

Manfaat

Konsentrat murni Aloe Vera memberikan kelembaban dan kelembutan tahan lama pada kulit.

Kandungan bioteknologi Gen IV melindungi kulit dan membantu memulihkan kulit yang rusak akibat paparan pada sinar UV dan lingkungan yang polutif.

Teknologi liposome Gen III membantu mencegah penuaan dini kulit dengan meningkatkan proses pembentukan sel-sel baru kulit dan membantu meingkatkan produksi kolagen.

Formula khusus tumbuh-tumbuhan adaptogenik menormalkan fungsi kulit dan memberikan perlindungan anti-penuaan dini dan anti-stres pada kulit untuk membantu kulit menghadapi pengaruh buruk internal dan eksternal.

Buah Acai (Euterpe Oleracea) merupakan buah yang kaya dengan zat antioksidan yang kuat, phytosterol dan anthocyanin untuk melawan proses penuaan dini kulit.

Vitamin A, B, C dan E memberi nutrisi pada kulit, memberikan perlindungan antioksidan dan membantu menjaga kesehatan kulit.

Tidak mengandung wewangian.

Tidak mengandung paraben.
